嚬字的基本解释

嚬
pín
笑的样子。
古同“颦”。

嚬字的汉语字典释义

[①]［pín］
［《廣韻》步真切，平真，並。］
(1)同“顰”。皱眉。
(2)张口。参见“嚬伸”。

嚬字的康熙字典解释

【丑集上】【口字部】　嚬； 康熙笔画：19； 页码：页213第35
【廣韻】符眞切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】吡賔切，?音頻。【正字通】眉蹙貌。【通鑒】韓昭侯曰：明主愛一嚬一笑。【王筠詩】斂笑動微嚬。　又【正字通】通作顰。【駱賔王詩】妝鏡菱花暗，愁眉柳葉顰。　又通作矉。【莊子·天運篇】西施病心而矉。【註】蹙額曰矉。【李白詩】蛾眉不可妒，况乃效其矉。　又借作頻。【孟子】已頻願曰。【王充·論衡】薄酒酸苦，賔主頻蹙。○按《正字通》云嚬與言部?別，未聞訓嚬爲笑者，信如舊註，則一嚬一笑，猶言一笑一笑也，於義難解。各韻書以爲笑貌，俱誤。

嚬字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
嚬字的起名意思

暂无。

knit the brows
Basic explanation of words
knit the brows
pín
Smile.
Gu Tong is "sniff".
knit the brows
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［pín］
["Guangyun" step is true, plain, and. ]
(1) Same as "颦". frown.
(2) Open your mouth. See "嚬长".
knit the brows
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Chou Ji 1] [Words Department] 　嚬; Kangxi strokes: 19; Page number: page 213-35
[Guang Yun] Fu Suiqie [Jiyun] [Yunhui] [Zhengyun] Pisi cut, audio. [Zhengzitong] Frowning eyebrows. [Tong Jian] Han Zhaohou said: Ming Zhu loves a hum of love and a smile. [Wang Yun's poems] Converging laughter and moving slightly.　[Zhengzitong] It's all a fringe. [Poems of the King of Luo's Bladder] The makeup mirror is dark, and the eyebrows are frowning with willow leaves.　It's all over again. [Zhuangzi·Tianyun Chapter] Xi Shi is sick and heartbroken. 【Note】Fucked the forehead and said 矉. [Li Bai's Poetry] Moth eyebrows are not to be jealous.　 Also borrowed for frequency. [Mencius] has frequently wished and said. [Wang Chong·Lunheng] Bojiu is sour and bitter, and the main bladder is frowned frequently. ○According to "Zhengzitong", Yunhao and Yanbu? Farewell, and those who have not heard of training as a laughter, believe in the old note, they will laugh and laugh. The rhyme books think that they are smiling, and they are all wrong.
